content: the **granny ripple scarf** is a warm and cozy scarf that is perfect for fall and winter for my scarf i used scrap balls of yarn but you can create your unique color palette the pattern is written for a **classic scarf** with two ripples and an **infinity scarf** with three ripples > this pattern is featured in the > ** 2025 holiday stashdown crochet along cal 1 ** with cal central > every monday and thursday from > **september 29 through december 15 2025** we ll share a free crochet > pattern these patterns include > gifts decorations or wraps for the > winter holidays each pattern is > either a **one-skein project** or a > **scrappy** project using 100 yards or less of each color which is perfect > for using some of your yarn stash > visit underground crafter 2 to > learn more about cal and the > end-of-cal giveaway prizes *this pattern is written in us terms* **materials** dk 3 light weight yarn 4 0 mm g/6 us 8 uk crochet hook tapestry needle **yarn** for the scarf i used **paintbox yarns simply dk** *302 yds / 276 m per 100 g* in the following colors and amounts vanilla cream 107 144 yds / 132 m glorious gold 66 192 yds / 176 m red wine 115 192 yds / 176 m khaki green 78 192 yds / 176 m for the infinity scarf i used **hobbii amigo** *191 yds / 175 m per 50 g* in the following colors and amounts light gray melange a08 287 yds / 263 m dark magenta a52 165 yds / 151 m navy blue a20 165 yds / 151 m feel free to use any comparable yarn that meets gauge **size** **scarf** 78 7 200 cm by 9 6 24 5 cm **infinity scarf** 26 2 66 5 cm by 10 2 26 cm after seaming **gauge** **scarf** 7 3-double_crochet-cluster for 6 row in 4 10 cm working the granny ripple st according to pattern **infinity scarf** 7 3-double_crochet-cluster for 6 5 row in 4 10 cm
